name: An Wang 0002
content: An Wang | Case School of Engineering Skip to main content An Wang An Wang Alignment None Assistant Professor Dept of Electrical Engineering & Computer Science Office: Olin 407 Phone: 216.368.5525 [Google Scholar]    Email: axw474 [AT] case dot edu Short Bio An joined Department of Electrical Engineering & Computer Science at Case in July, 2018 after she obtained her Ph.D. from George Mason University, Department of Computer Science, Systems Lab in May 2018, under the supervision of Prof. Songqing Chen Multiple research position available for self-motivated Ph.D/MS student interested in computer networks and security, distributed machine learning, edge computing and IoT security Research Interests My research interests focus on network security, distributed system and software-defined networking (SDN). The topics I have been working on include Distributed Denial of Service attacks modeling and mitigation Programmable and flexible network functions integration to SDN architecture Security and safety monitoring in IoT (Recent Publication (Full List Alasmary, H., Anwar, A., Abusnaina, A., Alabduljabbar, A., Abuhamad, M., Wang, A., Nyang, D.H., Awad, A. and Mohaisen, D., 2021. SHELLCORE: Automating Malicious IoT Software Detection Using Shell Commands Representation. IEEE Internet of Things Journal. Liu, L., Wang, H., Wang, A., Xiao, M., Cheng, Y., Chen, S., 2021. Mind the Gap: Broken Promises of CPU Reservations in Containerized Multi-tenant Clouds. In Proceedings of the sixth ACM symposium on cloud computing (SoCC). Choi, J., Abusnaina, A., Anwar, A., Wang, A., Chen, S., Nyang, D. and Mohaisen, A., 2019, November. Honor Among Thieves: Towards Understanding the Dynamics and Interdependencies in IoT Botnets. In 2019 IEEE Conference on Dependable and Secure Computing (DSC) . IEEE. Mi, Y. and Wang, A., 2019, December. ML-pushback: Machine learning based pushback defense against DDoS. In Proceedings of the 15th International Conference on emerging Networking EXperiments and Technologies (CoNEXT). Wang, A., Chang, W., Chen, S., Mohaisen, A. A Data-Driven Study of DDoS Attacks and Their Dynamics. IEEE Transactions on Dependable and Secure Computing. 2018. Zha, Z., Wang, A., Guo, Y., Montgomery, D., Chen, S. Instrumenting Open vSwitch with Monitoring Capabilities: Designs and Challenges. In Proceedings of the Symposium on SDN Research. 2018. Professional Activities Technical Program Committee Member: CLOUD' 2019 Organize Ph.D. Student Forum at SEC' 2019 (Please submit your work and help publicize the Poster) Publicity Co-Chair: CoNEXT' 2019 (Please consider submitting your work.
